title: Definitions
context: [ยง346-392] Definitions. As used in this part, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise: &ldquo;Case plan&rdquo; means a plan developed by the department, in consultation with the young adult, as developmentally appropriate, containing a written description of the programs and services that will help the young adult transition from foster care to independent living. &ldquo;Court&rdquo; means one of the family courts established pursuant to chapter 571. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of human services and its authorized representatives. &ldquo;Foster custody&rdquo; means the legal status created when the department places a child outside of the family home with the agreement of the legal custodian or pursuant to court order as set forth in chapter 587A. &ldquo;Party&rdquo; means the department or the young adult who is subject to a proceeding brought under this part and may include any other person whose participation the court finds is in the best interest of the young adult. &ldquo;Permanent custody&rdquo; means the legal status created by order of the court after the termination of parental rights as set forth in chapter 587A. &ldquo;Young adult&rdquo; means a person who has attained the age of eighteen or older, but is less than twenty-one years of age. [L 2013, c 252, pt of ยง2]
